text: Omg  I thought some jp shops only accept card not Apple Pay is because they let you place a card on the tray and they tap it for you. And it is kinda stupid to put phone on the tray.🤡

u are supposed to pay off ur statement in full each month. this applies to all banks.if u only pay minimum due  u will still incur interest charges.if u don’t pay at all  u will incur interest charges and late payment fees
Aiya. At this pt it's their custom to have the tray for cash/card already. I just accept it haha.

Hi my tbill mature date is 3rd sep. can I know how long is back to my dbs acc? I still see the investment there. I using cpf. I wanna transfer back.
Doesn’t matter as CPF pays lowest balance of the month. Move back 4th sep or 20th sep. Same.

By right today should be cash in cpf ia

Short answer doesn't work. You will only get 1.2mpd
Money shd appear ur dbs acc right

From dbs investment acc… I rem I did it during first time…
Yes u transfer it from your cpf investment account to your cpf ordinary account.
Is this done using cpf app or dbs?
I do mine with Uob desktop internet banking.
Hmmm let me see it need to be done from desktop
I manage to find the option using dbs desktop. Ty. Btw does it take a while for it to arrive to cpf or instant?

Uob one account paired with Uob lady credit card or Uob one credit card.

as in a time to say lock in   ur daily balance

Mt already gave you a decent option. Btw  as you said you are just starting ur first job  I suggest doing a simple calculation if your current spending level will get enough miles to redeem within reasonable amount of time (like max 2-3 years). If not  cashback card like uob one cc is a better choice imo.
I started the miles game in secondary school.
oops read wrongly. My suggestion still stands though.

Good morning all gurus  could I confirm that crmc rewards are based on statement month please? My apologies but could I also ask does statement month refers to the statement cycle please? Or is it still by month please? Thank you.
To add onto what the folks shared. If didn't pay a credit card bill in full  interest would also be charged onnew transactionsof the card that has not been billed as well.

My experience is by the next business day. If u r using DBS as the agent bank for your CPF OA Investment scheme  the interest rate is 0.05% (anyone know the interest for OCBC and UOB?). Given that the OA interest CPFB gives us is much higher than the agent bank  I wouldmanuallytransfer back to my CPF OA at the earliest opportunity rather than wait for 20 Sep or the end of the month

Then you just contradicted yourself. If DBS gives interest for keeping it in CPF-IA  it would be better to keep it till the end of month before transferring back to CPF-OA. At least you're getting some interest from DBS for keeping it in CPF-IS.
Sorry  can I check roughly how many days for it to get posted with crmc direct? Charged on 2 Sep. Still pending  today cut off for statement liao.
Thanks! I see where u r coming from. But I am a forgetful person so I won't want to risk missing out the 2.5% p.a interest to earn 0.05% p.a.
Giving advice to not risk is one thing  but telling people that transferring near end of month gets you lesser interest isfactually incorrect.P.S. UOB CPF-IA gives daily 0.05% p.a.
